info.title: Client Master Data
info.x-datev-shortdescription: Allows the exchange of master data between your software solutions and DATEV software.
info.description:
In the documentation below, you will receive detailed functional and technical specifications on the API DATEVconnect for Master Data.

**General information on dealing with fields administered as historical**
A number of fields in the  master data are administered as "historical". This means that the existing content is not overwritten when the field is updated, but that the existing value remains in place, with a new value added that is valid from a date entered by the user.

Specifically, the following fields are administered as historical:

*Ressource 'addressees'*
- short_names,
- surnames,
- company_names,
- legal_form_ids

*Subordinate object 'detail'*
- considerations,
- denominations,
- federal_states_of_natural_person,
- job_titles,
- marital_statuses,
- codes_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2008,
- descriptions_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2008,
- mad_codes_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2008,
- codes_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2003,
- descriptions_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2003,
- mad_codes_of_classification_of_economic_activities_2003,
- countries_of_head_office,
- distributions_of_profit,
- enterprise_purposes,
- federal_states_mad_of_legal_person,
- federal_states_of_legal_person,
- fiscal_years,
- kind_of_register_courts,
- locations_of_head_office,
- names_of_register_court,
- registered_company_names,
- registration_numbers,
- three_lined_company_names_first_line,
- three_lined_company_names_second_line,
- three_lined_company_names_third_line,
- two_lined_company_names_first_line,
- two_lined_company_names_second_line

These fields are shown as arrays, with their elements exhibiting the following structure:
- value,
- valid_from

This structure makes it possible to generate periods that indicate the validity date of a particular value in a value range.

This is illustrated by the following examples:

"job_titles":
[
  {"value":"Müller"},
  {"value":"Bäcker", "valid_from":"1995-04-01T00:00:00.000"},
  {"value":"Metzger", "valid_from":"2001-07-01T00:00:00.000"}
]
In this example, the profession "Müller" ("miller") was valid until 03/31/1995.
"Bäcker" ("baker") was valid from 04/01/1995 to 06/30/2001.
The value "Metzger" ("butcher") is valid starting 07/01/2001.

For all the historically administered fields listed above, there is an additional field that indicates the current value of the value range (the value that is valid today/as of the system time). The syntactic structure of the property name is as follows: current_<*Property name of the historically administered field in the singular*>.

In the example above, the property name is "current_job_title" with the value "Metzger" ("current_job_title": "Metzger").

When writing fields administered as historical, please note that both properties have to be entered to prevent content from being lost. This can once again be illustrated using the example above:

Starting on 01/01/2010, the person is no longer employed as a butcher ("Metzger"), but now works as a landlord ("Wirt") in the hospitality industry. In order to save this information in the master data, the request has to be as follows:

...

"job_titles":
[
  {"value":"Müller"},
  {"value":"Bäcker", "valid_from":"1995-04-01T00:00:00.000"},
  {"value":"Metzger", "valid_from":"2001-07-01T00:00:00.000"},
  {"value": "Wirt", "valid_from": "2010-01-01T00:00:00.000"}
],

"current_job_title": "Wirt",

...

If the property "current_job_title" had not been entered, but only the property "job_titles", then the current value ("landlord" in this example) would have been overwritten by a NULL value, as there would have been no explicit entry for the current value.

If, however, only the property "current_job_title" had been entered (i.e. without entering the property "job_titles"), then all historical values would have been overwritten. The result would have been the sole value of "landlord" without any time period set.

In summary, it can be said that the content of the property "current_job_title" overwrites the content of the valid array element of the property "job_titles".

Select.name: select
Select.description: Enter relevant attributes to which the results will then be limited.

FilterParameter.name: filter
FilterParameter.description: Entering a filter expression influences the number of results.

Expand.name: expand
Expand.description:
A parameter that makes it possible to read a resource along with all subordinate objects. 
If an asterisk (*) is entered, all subordinate objects will be loaded with the resource.

MaxNumber.name: max-number
MaxNumber.description:
Parameter that enables the automatic issuing of a client number (by the system).
It determines the client number up to which a search can be performed for an available client number(= highest available client number).

NationalRight.name: national-right
NationalRight.description:
This parameter serves a dual purpose:

**A: Ressource 'legal-forms'**
Parameter that controls the display of company legal forms depending on national law.

If 'national-right=german' is entered, then all company legal forms will be listed that are relevant to addressees subject to German law.
If 'national-right=austrian' is entered, then all company legal forms will be listed that are relevant to addressees subject to Austrian law.

**B: Ressource 'addressees'**
Parameter defines the national law that will be saved with the addressee. If the parameter is not entered, the national law that corresponds to the product installed will be entered as the default option:

If the package 'DATEV Basis für Österreich' is installed, then "Austrian" will be set as the applicable national law for the addressee.
If the package 'DATEV Basis' is installed, then "German" will be set as the applicable national law for the addressee.

Start.name: start
Start.description: This parameter sets the client number from which a search for the next available client number will be started.

Range.name: range
Range.description: This parameter sets the range within which a search for the next available client number will be performed. If the parameter is not entered, then the default is 1000. If, for example, the "start" parameter is set to 10000 and the "range" parameter to 20000, then a search for the next available client number will be performed in the client number range from 10000 to 30000.

ClientCategoryTypeId.name: client-category-type-id
ClientCategoryTypeId.description: The GUID of a client categorie type.

ClientGroupTypeId.name: client-group-type-id
ClientGroupTypeId.description: The GUID of a client group type.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of clients.
get.description:
**Filter** Unless further parameters are entered, the list will contain both active and inactive clients.

**Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - name - number - status - timestamp - type - natural_person_id - legal_person_id - organization_id - organization_name - organization_number - establishment_id - establishment_name - establishment_number - establishment_short_name - functional_area_id - functional_area_name - functional_area_short_name
**Operators**
*Filter Option: number, timestamp, organization_number, establishment_number* | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal |
*Filter Option: name, organization_name, establishment_name, establishment_short_name, functional_area_name, functional_area_short_name* | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal | | contains(property, substring) | Search for Substring in property's value | | startswith(property, substring)| Search for Substring at the beginning of the property's value |
*Filter Option: status, type, organization_id, establishment_id, functional_area_id, natural_person_id, legal_person_id* | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------------------------------------------------------| | eq | Equal |
**Filter Combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**URI Examples** *Retrieving a client with the client number 20000* .../clients?filter=number eq 20000

*Retrieving all clients whose client number is greater than or equal to 10000 and less than 70000* .../clients?filter=number ge 20000 and number lt 70000

*Retrieving all clients whose name contains the word "Mustermeier"* .../clients?filter=contains(name, Mustermeier)

*Retrieving all active clients* .../clients?filter=status eq active

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

post.description:
When creating a new client, please note that the addressee (POST /addressees) has to be created first, followed by the client (POST /clients). The property "legal_person_id" or "natural_person_id" must be completed in accordance with the property "type".

If **type is natural_person**, then complete **natural_person_id** with the GUID of the **addressee (person)** created.
If **type is legal_person**, then complete **legal_person_id** with the GUID of the **addressee (enterprise)** created.
If **type is individual_enterprise**, then complete **natural_person_id and legal_person_id** with the GUIDs of the **addressees (person and enterprise)** created.

get.summary: Retrieve a list of deleted clients.
get.description:
**Filter** Unless a filter is entered, the list will contain all deleted clients. The "timestamp" filter option can be used to limit the results to a specific time period.

**Filter Options** The number of results can be limited by using the following filters: - id - timestamp
**Operators**
*Filter Option: timestamp* | Operator | Description | |-------------------|-----------------------------| | eq | Equal | | gt | Greater than | | ge | Greater than or equal | | lt | Less than | | le | Less than or equal |
*Filter Option: id* | Operator | Description | |--------------------------------|----------------| | eq | Equal |
**Filter Combinations** Filters can be combined using the operator "and".

**URI Examples** *Retrieving deleted clients who were deleted after 03/31/2018.* .../clients/deletion-log?filter=timestamp gt 2018-03-31T00:00:00.000

get.summary: Retrieve an addressee.
get.description:
**Retrieving an addressee with subordinate objects** By including the parameter expand=* in the URI, the full scope of the addressee object will be requested. If, instead of the asterisk (*), the property name of the subordinate object is entered, the addressee object will be requested with the stated subordinate object (e.g. "expand=detail, addresses" retrieves the addressee object along with the addressee details and addresses).
In the standard case, without the expand parameter, the addressee object will be requested without subordinate objects (addressee details, addresses, communication details, bank_accounts and tax_offices).

400.description: A client error has occurred. One possible cause might be that an incorrect value has been transferred. Further information is contained in the response message.

404.description: The requested resource is either permanently or temporarily not available. One possible cause might be an incorrect URI.

put.description:
With the PUT command, the addressee will be completely overwritten (addressee incl. subordinate objects).
We therefore recommend that you perform a request, with the parameter expand=*, of the addressee being updated beforehand in order to prevent master data from being overwritten.
The following properties may not be changed: - id - type

Link.description: The link contains a self-reference with the ID of the updated object.

post.description:
When creating a new consultancy employee, please note that the addressee of the type "natural_person" (POST /addressees) has to be created first, followed by the consultancy employee (POST /employees). The property "natural_person_id" must be completed with the GUID of the created addressee.
If the property "number" is not specified or completed with 0, then the system assigns the number automatically. In this case the largest assigned number is increased by 1. If the number 99999 is already assigned, the system fills the gaps.

The central client number then represents the smallest available client number; the value entered in the parameter represents the largest possible client number. Within this range (central client number/max-number), the server will automatically issue the client number. If there are no available client numbers left, error code 400 will be returned.

date_of_birth.description:
Date of birth of a natural person.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

etin.description:
The eTIN is an income tax-related identification number given to every employee in Germany; the legal basis is Section 41b (2) of the German Income Tax Act (EStG). However, the calculation method does not exclude the possibility that the same eTIN might be assigned to more than one person. As it is sufficiently unlikely, however, that two different people with the same eTIN fall within the jurisdiction of the same tax authority, this is acceptable for the purposes of the eTIN. The eTIN is a 14-character code that is made up of the following personal data; last name, first name, and date of birth; it comprises the upper-case letters A to Z, as well as the digits 0 to 9. As long as this personal data does not change (e.g. a change of name upon marriage), the eTIN will remain valid; otherwise, it has to be amended to reflect the change in name.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

firstname.description:
First name of a natural person.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

sex.description:
Gender of a natural person.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

surnames.description: The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

current_surname.description:
Current last name of a natural person (= value as at system date). Mandatory field if you wish to create an addressee of the type "natural_person".

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

tax_identification_number.description:
Unique tax identification number for natural persons as per Section 139b of the German Fiscal Code (AO).

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

company_names.description: The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

current_company_name.description:

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

date_of_foundation.description:

legal_form_ids.description: The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

timestamp.description: Indicates when the client category assignment was last edited.

id.description: GUID of a client group type – internal identifier. The ID may not be entered with POST (it is issued by the system); with PUT, however, the ID is a mandatory field.

name.description: Name of the client group type.

note.description: Note about a client group type.

short_name.description: Short name of the client group type. The short name must be unique.

timestamp.description: Indicates when the client group type was last edited.

id.description: GUID of a client group assignment - internal identifier.

client_group_type_id.description: GUID of a client group type - identifies a client group type.

client_group_type_short_name.description: Short name of the client group type.

complimentary_close.description: The complimentary close defines the sign-off used for an addressee in correspondence.

correspondence_title.description: The title is the way in which an addressee is addressed. Examples are "Ms." or "Mr."

national_right.description: Indicates which national law governs the provision of services to the addressee. Accounting may, for example, be carried out in accordance with Austrian law. It is currently possible to choose between German (DE) and Austrian (AT) law.

salutation.description: Enter the salutation for correspondence as you wish it to appear in letters. For example, "Dear Ms. Sample,". The salutation should therefore include both the name and the punctuation.

all_first_names.description:
All first names of a natural person.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

Indicates the way in which identity has been confirmed. The following values are permissible (EZ = Erkennungszeuge, FS = Führerschein, PA = Personalausweis, PB = Persönliche Bekanntschaft, RP = Reisepass, SA = Sonstiger Ausweis, SK = Besondere Sachkunde, UK = Urkunde, IN = Elektronischer Identitätsnachweis, ES = Qualifizierte elektronische Signatur, IS = Elektronisches Identifizierungssystem).

Pension insurance institute is the name of the insurer/organization with which a natural person holds a pension.

Place of birth of a natural person.

Register office where a natural person’s birth was registered.

social_security_number.description:
Unique social security number. The maximum length depends on the national law applicable to the natural person. If national_right='DE', the max. length is 12 characters. If national_right='AT', the max. length is 13 characters.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'natural_person'.

current_two_lined_company_name_first_lin.description:
Current first line of the two-line company name (= value as at system date).

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

two_lined_company_names_second_line.description: The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

current_two_lined_company_name_second_li.description:
Current second line of the two-line company name (= value as at system date).

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

winding_up_date.description:
Indicates the date on which a company was wound up.

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

winding_up_proceedings.description:
In corporate and associations law, "winding-up" describes the start of the period in which the entity moves from commercial operations into the phase of liquidation/administration of its operations – until it ceases to exist. Meaning of the values (IA = i.A., IL = i.L., INABW = in Abwicklung, INLIQ = in Liquidation).

The property may only be filled if the addressee is of the type 'legal_person'.

id.description: GUID - internal ID of an address.

type.description: Address type (street address, PO box address, corporate client address). One of these must be selected when creating a new address. Otherwise, this field will be read-only.

city.description: Indicates the location. The maximum length depends on the country in which the address is located (for 'DE' and 'AT' 30 characters; for 'PL' 41 characters; for any other country or if no country has been defined 62 characters are permissible).

country_code.description: Indicates the country in which the address is located. The following values are permissible (see “country_of_birth” definition).

postal_code.description: Indicates the postal code. The maximum length depends on the country in which the address is located ('DE' 5 digits, 'AT' 4 digits, 'IT' 5 digits, 'CZ' 6 digits, 'PL' 6 digits.  For 'DE' and 'AT', the maximum and minimum lengths are the same. For any other country or if no country has been defined 10 digits are permissible).

post_office_box.description:
Indicates the post office box.

The property may only be filled if the address is of the type 'post_office_box'.

street.description:
Indicates the street. The maximum length depends on the country in which the address is located (for 'DE' and 'AT' 36 characters; for any other country or if no country has been defined 41 characters are permissible).
The property may only be filled if the address is of the type 'street'.

additional_correspondence_title.description: Indicates a differing title in correspondence.

additional_delivery_text1.description: Indicates the first part of the name of the differing delivery addressee.

additional_delivery_text2.description: Indicates the second part of the name of the differing delivery addressee.

additional_shipping_information.description: Indicates additional shipping information in correspondence, e.g. private/confidential or a shipment.

address_appendix.description: Indicates an address appendix in correspondence, e.g. "c/o".

is_address_manually_edited.description: Indicates whether the address has been manually edited.

note.description: Field for notes about the address.
note.example: Das ist eine Notiz zur Anschrift

valid_from.description: Indicates the date from which an address is valid.

valid_to.description: Indicates the date until which an address is valid.

currently_valid.description: Indicates whether or not the address is currently valid.

is_correspondence_address.description: Indicates whether this is the correspondence address. Among all valid addresses  of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

is_debitor_address.description: Indicates whether this is the debtor address. Among all valid addresses of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' no more than once.

is_main_post_office_box_address.description: Indicates whether this is the main post office box address. Only relevant if the address is a post office box address (type=post_office_box). Among all valid post office box addresses of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

is_main_street_address.description: Indicates whether this is the main street address. Only relevant if the address is a street address (type=street). Among all valid street addresses of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

is_management_address.description: Indicates whether this is the management address. Only relevant if the associated addressee is of the type 'legal_person'. Among all valid addresses of an addressee (legal_person), this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

id.description: GUID - internal ID of a communication link.

type.description: Indicates the type of communication medium to which a certain number/address relates. Can only be selected when creating a new communication link. Otherwise, this field will be read-only.

data_content.description: Indicates the number (e.g. telephone number) or address (e.g. e-mail address) of the communication medium concerned.

number_standardized.description: Indicates the telephone number/fax number without special characters (purely as a sequence of digits).

note.description: Field for notes about the communication link.

is_main_communication.description: Indicates the standard communication link for each means of communication. If communication_type is 'other', then this property may not be set to 'true'. Apart from this, exactly one of the communication links for the means of communication must be marked as 'true'.

is_management_phone.description: Indicates the management phone. Only relevant if the communication type is 'phone' and the associated addressee is of the type 'legal_person'. Exactly one telephone line of the corresponding addressee must be marked as 'true'.

id.description: GUID - internal ID of a bank account.

bank_account_number.description: Number of the bank account. The maximum length depends on the country in which the bank account is located (property country_code). For 'DE' 10 digits; for 'AT' 11 digits; for 'PL' 16 digits; for 'IT' 20 digits; for 'CZ' 17 digits. For any other country 30 digits are permissible.

bank_code.description: Code number for identification all banks within a country. Bank branches are not identified. The maximum length depends on the country in which the bank is located (property country_code). For 'DE' 8 digits; for 'AT' 5 digits; for 'PL' 8 digits. For any other country 10 digits are permissible.

bic.description: Unique identifier for a SWIFT-participant (BIC - Bank Identifier Code). SWIFT is the abbreviation for "Society for Worldwide Interbank Financial Telecommunications".

country_code.description: Indicates the country in which the bank is located. The following values are permissible (see “country_of_birth” definition).

differing_account_holder.description: Name of the account holder, if is not the associated addressee.

note.description: Field for notes about the bank account.
note.example: Das ist eine Notiz zur Bankverbindung.

valid_from.description: Indicates the date from which a bank account is valid.

valid_to.description: Indicates the date until which a bank account is valid.

currently_valid.description: Indicates whether or not the bank account is currently valid.

is_main_bank_account.description: Indicates whether this is the main bank account. Among all valid bank accounts of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

id.description: GUID - internal ID of a tax office.

country_code.description: Indicates the country in which the tax office is located. The following values are permissible (see “country_of_birth” definition).

note.description: Field for notes about the tax office.
note.example: Das ist eine Notiz zur Finanzamtsverbindung.

tax_number.description: Indicates the tax number which is assigned to the tax payer.

tax_number_certificated.description: Indicates the tax number which is certified according to ELSTER guideline.

tax_number_standardized.description: Indicates the tax number without special characters (purely as a sequence of digits).

tax_office_number.description: Indicates the number of the tax office. This number identifies a tax office.

valid_from.description: Indicates the date from which a tax office is valid.

valid_to.description: Indicates the date until which a tax office is valid.

currently_valid.description: Indicates whether or not the tax office is currently valid.

is_competent_for_operational_income_tax.description: Indicates whether the tax office is competent for operating tax respectively income tax. Among all valid tax offices of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' exactly once.

is_competent_for_turnover_tax.description: Indicates whether the tax office is competent for turnover tax. Among all valid tax offices of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' no more than once.

is_competent_for_wage_tax.description: Indicates whether the tax office is competent for wage tax. Among all valid tax offices of an addressee, this property must be marked with 'true' no more than once.

id.description: GUID of the contact person relationship.

addressee_id.description: GUID of the addressee, who is contact person.

department.description: Department in which the contact person is active.

display_name.description: Display name comprising a last and a first name of the contact person.

note.description: Field for notes about the contact person.

value.description: Name of a business, firm, company, or association.
Internal identifier of the corresponding legal form.
Short name for addressees.
Last name of the addressee.

A federal state is a subdivision of a federal country. The values depend on the national law applicable to the natural/legal person. If national_right='DE', the following values are permissible (BAY = Bayern, BBG = Brandenburg, BDW = Baden-Württemberg, BER = Berlin, BRE = Bremen, HBG = Hamburg, HES = Hessen, MLB = Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, NRS = Niedersachsen, NRW = Nordrhein-Westfalen, RLP = Rheinland-Pfalz, SAA = Sachsen-Anhalt, SAC = Sachsen, SAR = Saarland, SWH = Schleswig-Holstein, THG = Thüringen). If national_right='AT', the following values are permissible (BGL = Burgenland, KTN = Kärnten, NOE = Niederösterreich, OOE = Oberösterreich, SBG = Salzburg, STM = Steiermark, TIR = Tirol, VBG = Vorarlberg, W = Wien).

Indicates the reason why a child aged over 18 is included on their parents’ income tax return. This entry is only relevant to natural persons who are children of another addressee (parent). The following values are permissible (ARBEITSU = Arbeit suchend, AUSBILDG = Schul-/Berufsausbildung, BEHINDERG = Wegen Behinderung außerstande, sich selbst zu unterhalten, FEHLAUSB = Fehlender Ausbildungsplatz, FREIDST = Freiwilligendienst - kein Zivildienst, FREIWEHR = Freiwilliger Wehrdienst, GRDDST = Gesetzlicher Grundwehr-/Zivildienst oder davon befreiender Dienst, UEBERGANG = Übergangszeit von höchstens vier Monaten).

Religion of a natural person. The following values are permissible (AK = Altkatholisch, EV = Evangelisch, FA = Freie Religionsgemeinschaft Alzey, FB = Freireligiöse Landesgemeinde Baden, FG = Freireligiöse Landesgemeinde Pfalz, FM = Freireligiöse Gemeinde Mainz, FS = Freireligiöse Gemeinde Offenbach/M., IB = Israelitische Religionsgemeinschaft Baden, IF = Israelitische Kultussteuer Frankfurt, IH = Jüdische Kultussteuer Schleswig Holstein, IK = Israelitische Bekenntnissteuer (Bayern), IL = Israelitische Kultussteuer der kultusberechtigten Gemeinden (Hessen), IS = Israelitische Kultussteuer, IW = Israelitische Religionsgemeinschaft Württemberg, JB = Jüdische Kultusgemeinde Bad Kreuznach, JD = Jüdische Kultussteuer (Nordrhein-Westfalen), JH = Jüdische Kultussteuer (Hamburg), JK = Jüdische Kultusgemeinde Koblenz, JU = Jüdische Kultussteuer (Rheinland-Pfalz), KK = Katholische Kirchensteuer (Niedersachsen), KL = Konfessionslos, RK = Römisch-katholisch, SO = Sonstige (mit Kirchensteuerberechnung), SY = Synagogengemeinde Saar, VD = Sonstige (ohne Kirchensteuerberechnung)).
Work or activity in which a natural person is trained and earns a living.

The status of a natural person in respect of their family circumstances. The values depend on the national law applicable to the natural person. If national_right='DE', the following values are permissible (GS = Geschieden, GT = Dauernd getrennt lebend, LE = Ledig, PA = Lebenspartnerschaft aufgehoben, PE = Lebenspartnerschaft eingetragen, VH = Verheiratet, VW = Verwitwet). If national_right='AT', the following values are permissible (GS = Geschieden, GT = Dauernd getrennt lebend, LE = Ledig, PL = In Partnerschaft lebend, VH = Verheiratet).

Code of classification of economic activities as per the 2008 classification. These codes are used to classify enterprises by industry, type and sector. The code is a prerequisite for comparing enterprises. This code is the official code of the German Federal Statistical Office (w/o DATEV extensions).
Description of classification of economic activities as per the 2008 classification.
Code of classification of economic activities (2008) with DATEV extensions.

Code of classification of economic activities as per the 2003 classification. These codes are used to classify enterprises by industry, type and sector. The code is a prerequisite for comparing enterprises. This code is the official code of the German Federal Statistical Office (w/o DATEV extensions).
Description of classification of economic activities as per the 2003 classification.
Code of classification of economic activities (2003) with DATEV extensions.
Country in which the company has its head office. The following values are permissible (see "country_of_birth" definition).

Indicates the method used to distribute profit (or loss) among the shareholders. The following values are permissible (ANDERER = Anderer Aufteilungsschlüssel, BRUCH = Nach Bruchteilen, BRUCHAUTO = Nach Bruchteilen mit automatischer Ermittlung des Gesamtnenners, EINKAP = Nach eingezahltem Kapital, GEZKAP = Nach gezeichnetem Kapital, KOPFMKOMP = Automatische Aufteilung nach Köpfen mit Berücksichtigung der Komplementäre, KOPFOKOMP = Automatische Aufteilung nach Köpfen ohne Berücksichtigung der Komplementäre, PROZENT = Nach Prozentanteilen).
The activity or the main output that a company produces. The main product line of a company can be derived from the enterprise purpose.

A federal state is a subdivision of a federal country. "FederalStateMAD" (client address data) includes extensions. In addition to the federal states, the following values are required - "Berlin-Ost" (for measuring the contribution assessment ceiling), "Nordbaden" (for checking the tax authorities responsible for Nordbaden), and "Bremerhaven" (which has different rules to Bremen on the distribution of church tax). The following values are permissible (1 = Baden-Württemberg ohne Nordbaden, 10 = Saarland, 11 = Schleswig-Holstein, 2 = Bayern, 3 = Berlin (ehem. West), 30 = Nordbaden, 31 = Bremerhaven, 4 = Bremen ohne Bremerhaven, 41 = Berlin (ehem. Ost), 42 = Brandenburg, 43 = Mecklenburg-Vorpommern, 44 = Sachsen, 45 = Sachsen-Anhalt, 46 = Thüringen, 5 = Hamburg, 6 = Hessen, 7 = Niedersachsen, 8 = Nordrhein-Westfalen, 9 = Rheinland-Pfalz).

The fiscal year indicates the date on which the fiscal year begins and the date on which the fiscal year ends. The fiscal year entry is valid for multiple years (e.g. 01013112 --> 01/01– 12/31 ; the fiscal year begins on January 1 and ends on December 31).

The type of court register in which a company is registered with the court.  The values depend on the national law applicable to the legal person. If national_right='DE', the following values are permissible (GEN = Genossenschaftsregister, GRB = Grundbuch, HAN = Handelsregister, PAR = Partnerschaftsregister, VER = Vereinsregister, GES = Gesellschaftsregister). If national_right='AT', the following values are permissible (FIR = Firmenbuch, GRU = Grundbuch, PRT = Partnerschaftsregister, VER = Vereinsregister).
Place in which the company has its head office.
Indicates the name of the register court (place of register court).
Name of the company as it is registered with the register court.
The registration number is the number under which a company is registered with a register court.
